name: Genoa Lakes Golf Club
description: Genoa Lakes offers two championship layouts: the Lakes Course , a links-style design with water on 14 holes, and the Ranch Course , a rugged high-desert course with over 300 feet of elevation changes.

faqs.question: What’s included in Genoa Lakes golf group packages?
faqs.answer: Lodging, guaranteed tee times, carts, and concierge planning. Optional transportation, dining, and multi-course itineraries.

faqs.question: What do Genoa Lakes group packages cost?
faqs.answer: Typical range is $179–$399 per golfer depending on dates, lodging selection, and group size.

faqs.question: Do you handle corporate or tournament groups?
faqs.answer: Yes—room blocks, tee-time blocks, tournament setup, and transportation for corporate and leisure groups.

meta.title: Genoa Lakes Golf Club | Carson Valley Golf Groups & Stay and Play
meta.description: Play Genoa Lakes in Carson Valley with golf groups, tee times, and stay-and-play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and leisure trips.

bodyText: Play Genoa Lakes in Carson Valley with golf groups, tee times, and stay-and-play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and leisure trips.

The Ranch Golf Course at Genoa Lakes
Built for power and distance, the Ranch Course cuts into the rugged Sierra Nevada foothills, just two miles from the Lakes Course.
Johnny Miller and John Harbottle III were the driving force behind this course, which offers wide open spaces and spectacular high desert views.
Over 300 feet of elevation changes, more than 100 bunkers, unpredictable mountain terrain, afternoon breezes and a waterfall challenge players to a crash course in championship golf.

The Lakes Golf Course at Genoa Lakes
Luxury and performance are the name of the game on the Lakes Course. Co-designed by PGA Champion Peter Jacobsen and John Harbottle III, this links-style course with rolling fairways meets head-on with the eastern slopes of the breathtaking Sierra Nevada Mountains.
Lush wetlands and the winding Carson River bring water into 14 holes of play, making long, straight drives the order of the day.
Home to the U.S. Open Qualifier.

Yes. Both courses are open to public play, with seasonal rates, twilight discounts, and group packages available.

tips.title: Is Genoa Lakes Golf Club open to the public?
tips.content: Yes. Both courses are open to public play, with seasonal rates, twilight discounts, and group packages available.

tips.title: Can I book a stay-and-play package with Genoa Lakes?

Built for power and distance, the Ranch Course cuts into the rugged Sierra Nevada foothills, just two miles from the Lakes Course.
Johnny Miller and John Harbottle III were the driving force behind this course, which offers wide open spaces and spectacular high desert views.
Over 300 feet of elevation changes, more than 100 bunkers, unpredictable mountain terrain, afternoon breezes and a waterfall challenge players to a crash course in championship golf.

Luxury and performance are the name of the game on the Lakes Course. Co-designed by PGA Champion Peter Jacobsen and John Harbottle III, this links-style course with rolling fairways meets head-on with the eastern slopes of the breathtaking Sierra Nevada Mountains.

featuredHole.title: Hole #5 — Par 3
featuredHole.description: A beautiful par 3 with the Sierra Nevada range framing the background. Water guards the front and right of the green. Club selection is critical at this elevation.

testimonials.quote: Our annual group plays Genoa Lakes Golf Club every year through GTHS. The course never disappoints — it's always in tournament condition. The Carson Valley, NV scenery makes it feel like a bucket-list round every time.
testimonials.author: Tina G.

testimonials.quote: Genoa Lakes Golf Club was the highlight of our Carson Valley, NV golf trip. Fairways were immaculate, pace of play was great, and the staff treated our group like VIPs. Golf the High Sierra nailed the tee time spacing for us.
testimonials.author: Pete N.

testimonials.quote: Booked Genoa Lakes Golf Club as part of a 3-course package with Golf the High Sierra. This was the standout round. Great elevation changes, strategic bunkering, and the staff couldn't have been more welcoming to our group of 20.
testimonials.author: Diego E.
